description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the remote code execution vulnerability in the Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server (CVE-2024-21367):

1. Identify the version of Windows in use from the list below:
   - Windows 11 Version 23H2: 10.0.22631.3155
   - Windows 11 Version 22H2: 10.0.22621.3155
   - Windows 11 Version 21H2: 10.0.22000.2777
   - Windows 10 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.10240.20469
   - Windows 10 for 32-bit Systems: 10.0.10240.20469
   - Windows 10 Version 22H2: 10.0.19045.4046
   - Windows 10 Version 21H2: 10.0.19044.4046

2. Download and install the appropriate KB update from the links below:
   - [KB5034765 for Windows 11 Version 23H2](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034765)
   - [KB5034765 for Windows 11 Version 22H2](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034765)
   - [KB5034766 for Windows 11 Version 21H2](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034766)
   - [KB5034774 for Windows 10](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034774)

3. Restart your system to apply the updates and ensure full resolution of potential vulnerabilities.

**Details**:
- This update addresses a CWE-122 heap-based buffer overflow which can lead to remote code execution if successfully exploited.
- Always ensure to backup your critical data before applying system updates.

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure the system is running a version of Windows compatible with the updates listed above.
